trans-unit.source: By using the built-in WaitFor\* resources (WaitForAll, WaitForAny, and WaitForSome), you can now specify dependencies across computers during configuration runs, without external orchestration.
trans-unit.target: By using the built-in WaitFor\* resources (WaitForAll, WaitForAny, and WaitForSome), you can now specify dependencies across computers during configuration runs, without external orchestration.

trans-unit.source: The behavior or each WaitFor\* resource is:
trans-unit.target: The behavior or each WaitFor\* resource is:

trans-unit.source: **WaitForAll** Waits for the specified resource to be in the desired state on *All* target nodes defined in the NodeName property.
trans-unit.target: **WaitForAll** Waits for the specified resource to be in the desired state on *All* target nodes defined in the NodeName property.

trans-unit.source: **WaitForAny** Waits for the specified resource to be in the desired state on *Any* target node defined in the NodeName property.
trans-unit.target: **WaitForAny** Waits for the specified resource to be in the desired state on *Any* target node defined in the NodeName property.

trans-unit.source: **WaitForSome** Waits for the specified resource to be in the desired state on specific number, defined by the property NodeCount, of target nodes defined in the NodeName property.
trans-unit.target: **WaitForSome** Waits for the specified resource to be in the desired state on specific number, defined by the property NodeCount, of target nodes defined in the NodeName property.

trans-unit.source: These resources provide node-to-node synchronization by using CIM connections over the WS-Man protocol.
trans-unit.target: These resources provide node-to-node synchronization by using CIM connections over the WS-Man protocol.

trans-unit.source: By using these resources, a configuration can wait for another computer’s specific resource state to change before it continues with its own configuration.
trans-unit.target: By using these resources, a configuration can wait for another computer’s specific resource state to change before it continues with its own configuration.

trans-unit.source: For example, in the following configuration, the target node is waiting for the **xADDomain** resource to finish on the **MyDC** node with a few retries, before the target node can join the domain.
trans-unit.target: For example, in the following configuration, the target node is waiting for the **xADDomain** resource to finish on the **MyDC** node with a few retries, before the target node can join the domain.

trans-unit.source: **Hint:** By default the WaitFor\* resources try one time and then fail so although it is not required, you will typically want to specify a regry interval and count.
trans-unit.target: **Hint:** By default the WaitFor\* resources try one time and then fail so although it is not required, you will typically want to specify a regry interval and count.
